TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit MediaExtractor extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: MediaExtractor facilitates extraction of demuxed, typically encoded, media data from a data source.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns an estimate of how much data is presently cached in memory expressed in microseconds.

Docs.summary: Extract DRM initialization data if it exists
Docs.value: DRM initialization data in the content, or null if no recognizable DRM format is found;

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class Android.Media.AudioPresentation> GetAudioPresentations(int32 trackIndex) cil managed

Docs.summary: Get the list of available audio presentations for the track.
Docs.returns: a list of available audio presentations for a given valid audio track index. The list will be empty if the source does not contain any audio presentations.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Android.Media.MediaExtractor/CasInfo GetCasInfo(int32 index) cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves the information about the conditional access system used to scramble a track.
Docs.returns: an CasInfo object describing the conditional access system.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool GetSampleCryptoInfo(class Android.Media.MediaCodec/CryptoInfo info) cil managed

Docs.param: The android.media.MediaCodec.CryptoInfo structure to be filled in.
Docs.summary: If the sample flags indicate that the current sample is at least partially encrypted, this call returns relevant information about the structure of the sample data required for decryption.
Docs.returns: true iff the sample flags contain #SAMPLE_FLAG_ENCRYPTED

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Get the track format at the specified index.

Docs.summary: Returns true iff we are caching data and the cache has reached the end of the data stream (for now, a future seek may of course restart the fetching of data).

Docs.summary: Return Metrics data about the current media container.
Docs.value:
a PersistableBundle containing the set of attributes and values available for the media container being handled by this instance of MediaExtractor. The attributes are descibed in MetricsConstants.
Additional vendor-specific fields may also be present in the return value.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .property instance class System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2<class Java.Util.UUID, unsigned int8[]> PsshInfo

Docs.summary: Get the PSSH info if present.
Docs.value: a map of uuid-to-bytes, with the uuid specifying the crypto scheme, and the bytes being the data specific to that scheme. This can be null if the source does not contain PSSH info.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

.method public hidebysig instance int32 ReadSampleData(class Java.Nio.ByteBuffer byteBuf, int32 offset) cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieve the current encoded sample and store it in the byte buffer starting at the given offset.
Docs.returns: the sample size (or -1 if no more samples are available).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Media.MediaExtractorSampleFlags SampleFlagEncrypted = (2)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Media.MediaExtractorSampleFlags enum directly instead of this field.", true)

Docs.summary: The sample is (at least partially) encrypted, see also the documentation for android.media.MediaCodec#queueSecureInputBuffer

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Media.MediaExtractorSampleFlags SampleFlagPartialFrame = (4)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Media.MediaExtractorSampleFlags enum directly instead of this field.", true)

Docs.summary: This indicates that the buffer only contains part of a frame, and the decoder should batch the data until a buffer without this flag appears before decoding the frame.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the current sample's flags.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Media.MediaExtractorSampleFlags enum directly instead of this field.", true)

Docs.summary: The sample is a sync sample (or in MediaCodec's terminology it is a key frame.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetDataSource(class Java.IO.FileDescriptor fd) cil managed

Docs.param: the FileDescriptor for the file you want to extract from.
Docs.summary: Sets the data source as a content Uri.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetDataSource(string path) cil managed

Docs.param:
the path of the file, or the http URL of the stream
When path refers to a local file, the file may actually be opened by a process other than the calling application. This implies that the pathname should be an absolute path (as any other process runs with unspecified current working directory), and that the pathname should reference a world-readable file. As an alternative, the application could first open the file for reading, and then use the file descriptor form .
Docs.summary: Sets the data source as a content Uri.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetDataSource(string path, class System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2<string, string> headers) cil managed

Docs.param: the headers to be sent together with the request for the data. This can be null if no specific headers are to be sent with the request.
Docs.summary: Sets the data source as a content Uri.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetDataSource (Android.Content.Context context, Android.Net.Uri uri, System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<string,string> headers);

.method public hidebysig instance void SetDataSource(class Android.Content.Context context, class Android.Net.Uri uri, class System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2<string, string> headers) cil managed
member this.SetDataSource : Android.Content.Context * Android.Net.Uri * System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<string, string> -> unit

Docs.param: the Context to use when resolving the Uri

the Content URI of the data you want to extract from.

When uri refers to a network file the android.Manifest.permission#INTERNET permission is required.
the headers to be sent together with the request for the data. This can be null if no specific headers are to be sent with the request.
Docs.summary: Sets the data source as a content Uri.
